content: Investments Stocks Discussion Asked by AnonymousAsked 2w agoWhat am I supposed to do for the AHREIT and Ascott merger?So I have briefly read through the Scheme Document and received the proxy forms for EGM and scheme meeting (with a reminder). I am still confused! Do I have to take any actions? Or can I just let it be? Generally, I don't attend meetings or vote.1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Elijah Lee, Independent Financial Advisor at Phillip Securities (Jurong East Lite)Top Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered 2w agoHi, if you don't attend meetings or vote, the EGM will still go on. The EGM is to approve the actions necessary to proceed with the merger, such as the merger itself, and the issuance of the new stapled units. If you don't attend, it is considered that you abstain.0 comments2
